fieldDescriptions.description: Specifies if browsing as a guest on managed ChromeOS devices is allowed.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Specifies if browsing as a guest on managed ChromeOS devices is allowed.

fieldDescriptions.description: Specifies whether only a subset of users can sign in to managed ChromeOS devices.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Restrict sign-in to a list of users.
Allow any user to sign in.
Do not allow any user to sign in.

fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Specifies whether only a subset of users can sign in to managed ChromeOS devices.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allowed users. Enter a list of usernames who can sign in to the device. You can also allow all email addresses in a domain with the wildcard symbol (e.g. *@example.com).
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Each string field in the list should be formatted in the format 'email'.
fieldDescriptions.name: Allowed users.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Enter a list of usernames who can sign in to the device. You can also allow all email addresses in a domain with the wildcard symbol (e.g. *@example.com).

fieldDescriptions.description: Determines whether the domain name is autocompleted on the sign-in screen of a managed ChromeOS device.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Use the domain name set in the field 'loginScreenDomainAutoCompletePrefix' for autocomplete at sign-in.
Do not display an autocomplete domain on the sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Determines whether the domain name is autocompleted on the sign-in screen of a managed ChromeOS device.

fieldDescriptions.description: Autocomplete domain prefix. Specifies the domain name to autocomplete on a managed ChromeOS device.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The string field should be formatted in the format 'domain name'.
fieldDescriptions.name: Autocomplete domain prefix.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Specifies the domain name to autocomplete on a managed ChromeOS device.

name: customers/C022n8w1u/policySchemas/chrome.devices.LoginScreenNamesAndPhotos
policyDescription: Show user names and photos on the sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.description: Sign-in screen name and photo visibility. Controls whether the sign-in screen shows names and photos of previously signed in users on managed ChromeOS devices.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Always show user names and photos.
Never show user names and photos.

fieldDescriptions.name: Sign-in screen name and photo visibility.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Controls whether the sign-in screen shows names and photos of previously signed in users on managed ChromeOS devices.

notices.noticeMessage: Warning: Use of this setting is not recommended for most deployments. See the sign-in screen help center article to learn more: https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1375678#show_user_names.

fieldDescriptions.description: Configures hours for which policy restrictions are less restrictive for managed ChromeOS devices.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: The timezone in which the time_windows apply. Omit for the timezone the device is currently in.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Fernando de Noronha Standard Time, GMT-02:00.
Australian Central Western Standard Time, GMT+08:45.

nestedFieldDescriptions.name: The timezone in which the time_windows apply. Omit for the timezone the device is currently in.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: The windows in which the device sign-in restrictions do not apply.
nestedFieldDescriptions.name: The windows in which the device sign-in restrictions do not apply.

fieldDescriptions.name: Configures hours for which policy restrictions are less restrictive for managed ChromeOS devices.

name: customers/C022n8w1u/policySchemas/chrome.devices.WipeUserData
policyDescription: Allows admins to make managed ChromeOS devices wipe user data after sign-out.

fieldDescriptions.description: Local user data retention. Determines whether a managed ChromeOS device erases user data after sign-out.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Do not erase local user data.

fieldDescriptions.name: Local user data retention.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Determines whether a managed ChromeOS device erases user data after sign-out.

notices.noticeMessage: Warning: Use of this setting is not recommended for most deployments. See the help center article for user data to learn more: https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1375678#ephemeral_users_enabled.

fieldDescriptions.description: Redirect users to SAML SSO IdP. Controls login authentication behavior for managed ChromeOS devices.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Take users to the default Google sign-in screen.
Allow users to go directly to SAML SSO IdP page.

fieldDescriptions.name: Redirect users to SAML SSO IdP.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Controls login authentication behavior for managed ChromeOS devices.

fieldDescriptions.description: Transfer single sign-on cookies into the user session during sign-in.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Enable transfer of SAML SSO Cookies into user session during sign-in.
Disable transfer of SAML SSO Cookies into user session during sign-in.

fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Transfer single sign-on cookies into the user session during sign-in.

notices.noticeMessage: This policy is only relevant if SAML SSO has been configured for Chrome Devices. <a Learn more about configuring SAML single sign-on for Chrome devices: https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/6060880

fieldDescriptions.description: Allowed single sign-on camera permissions. By enabling this policy, you are granting third parties access to your users' cameras on your users' behalf. Please ensure you read the help center articles for more clarifications around single sign-on and camera permissions.
fieldDescriptions.name: Allowed single sign-on camera permissions.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: By enabling this policy, you are granting third parties access to your users' cameras on your users' behalf. Please ensure you read the help center articles for more clarifications around single sign-on and camera permissions.

name: customers/C022n8w1u/policySchemas/chrome.devices.DeviceAutofillSamlUsername
policyDescription: Autofill username on SAML IdP login page.

fieldDescriptions.description: URL parameter name. Specify the URL parameter name which will be used on IdP login page to autofill the username field. See the help center article for some examples of fitting URL parameters. Warning: ChromeOS user's email will be used to autofill the username field, so do not use this policy if a different username should be used on IdP login page. This policy is only relevant if SAML SSO has been configured for Chrome Devices.
fieldDescriptions.name: URL parameter name.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Specify the URL parameter name which will be used on IdP login page to autofill the username field. See the help center article for some examples of fitting URL parameters. Warning: ChromeOS user's email will be used to autofill the username field, so do not use this policy if a different username should be used on IdP login page. This policy is only relevant if SAML SSO has been configured for Chrome Devices.

fieldDescriptions.description: Automatically select client certificate for these single sign-on sites. Please refer to the support url for the format of this setting.
fieldDescriptions.name: Automatically select client certificate for these single sign-on sites.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Please refer to the support url for the format of this setting.

fieldDescriptions.description: Configures the language used on the login screen for managed ChromeOS devices.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Use the language of the last user session.

fieldDescriptions.name: Configures the language used on the login screen for managed ChromeOS devices.

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls which keyboards are available for ChromeOS devices when trying to sign in.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: The list of ids for the available keyboard types the user can select at the login screen. The keyboards will appear in the same order as this list.
nestedFieldDescriptions.name: The list of ids for the available keyboard types the user can select at the login screen. The keyboards will appear in the same order as this list.

fieldDescriptions.name: Controls which keyboards are available for ChromeOS devices when trying to sign in.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allowed IdP redirect URLs. Enter the list of URLs that you want to be able to perform a verified access check during SAML authentication.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Each string field in the list should be formatted in the format 'url'.
fieldDescriptions.name: Allowed IdP redirect URLs.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Enter the list of URLs that you want to be able to perform a verified access check during SAML authentication.

fieldDescriptions.description: Determines when and how users can display system information on the sign-in screen.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Always display system information on the sign-in screen.
Do not allow users to display system information on the sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Determines when and how users can display system information on the sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.description: This setting is only supported on devices with an electronic privacy screen.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Always enable the privacy screen on sign-in screen.
Always disable the privacy screen on sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: This setting is only supported on devices with an electronic privacy screen.

fieldDescriptions.description: Determines whether a numeric keyboard should be shown for password input.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Default to a numeric keyboard for password input.
Default to a standard keyboard for password input.

fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Determines whether a numeric keyboard should be shown for password input.

name: customers/C022n8w1u/policySchemas/chrome.devices.DeviceLoginScreenExtensionManifestVTwoAvailability
policyDescription: Manifest v2 extension availability on sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.description: Manifest v2 extension availability on sign-in screen.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Disable manifest V2 extensions on the sign-in screen.
Enable manifest V2 extensions on the sign-in screen.
Enable force-installed manifest V2 extensions on the sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Manifest v2 extension availability on sign-in screen.

name: customers/C022n8w1u/policySchemas/chrome.devices.DeviceAuthenticationUrlBlocklist
policyDescription: Blocked URLs on the sign-in / lock screens.

fieldDescriptions.description: Blocked URLs. Any URL in this list will be blocked, unless it also appears in the list of exceptions in the corresponding allowlist.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The list should have 1000 or less entries. Each string field in the list should be formatted in the format 'url filter'.
fieldDescriptions.name: Blocked URLs.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Any URL in this list will be blocked, unless it also appears in the list of exceptions in the corresponding allowlist.

name: customers/C022n8w1u/policySchemas/chrome.devices.DeviceAuthenticationUrlAllowlist
policyDescription: Blocked URL exceptions on the sign-in / lock screens.

fieldDescriptions.description: Blocked URL exceptions. Any URL that matches an entry in this exception list will be allowed, even if it matches a line in the blocked URLs. Wildcards ("*") are allowed when appended to a URL, but cannot be entered alone. Maximum of 1000 URLs.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The list should have 1000 or less entries. Each string field in the list should be formatted in the format 'url filter'.
fieldDescriptions.name: Blocked URL exceptions.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Any URL that matches an entry in this exception list will be allowed, even if it matches a line in the blocked URLs. Wildcards ("*") are allowed when appended to a URL, but cannot be entered alone. Maximum of 1000 URLs.

name: customers/C022n8w1u/policySchemas/chrome.devices.DeviceLoginScreenWebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls
policyDescription: WebUSB API allowed devices on sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allows automatically granting permissions to specific sites on the sign-in screen to connect to USB devices with the given vendor and product IDs via the WebUSB API.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: A list of web applications, each with its allowed USB devices.

Web application origin URL. Access to the devices applies to the entire web origin. Any path will be truncated. For detailed information on valid URL patterns, see https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/url-patterns. Note that using the "*" wildcard is not valid. The maximum size is 1000 characters.
nestedFieldDescriptions.name: Web application origin URL. Access to the devices applies to the entire web origin. Any path will be truncated. For detailed information on valid URL patterns, see https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/url-patterns. Note that using the "*" wildcard is not valid. The maximum size is 1000 characters.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: A list of USB devices allowed for this web application. Each device has format 'vendor_id:product_id' where each of the IDs is a hexadecimal 4-char string. An example of a device ID: '1234:ab12'. The maximum size is 500000 characters (for all entries combined).
nestedFieldDescriptions.name: A list of USB devices allowed for this web application. Each device has format 'vendor_id:product_id' where each of the IDs is a hexadecimal 4-char string. An example of a device ID: '1234:ab12'. The maximum size is 500000 characters (for all entries combined).
A list of web applications, each with its allowed USB devices.

fieldDescriptions.name: Allows automatically granting permissions to specific sites on the sign-in screen to connect to USB devices with the given vendor and product IDs via the WebUSB API.

name: customers/C022n8w1u/policySchemas/chrome.devices.DeviceLoginScreenWebHidAllowDevicesForUrls
policyDescription: WebHID API allowed devices on sign-in screen.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allows automatically granting permissions to specific sites on the sign-in screen to connect to HID devices with the given vendor and product IDs.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: A list of web origins, each with its allowed USB devices.

Web origin URL. Access to the devices applies to the entire web origin. Any path will be truncated. For detailed information on valid URL patterns, see https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/url-patterns. Note that using the "*" wildcard is not valid. The maximum size is 1000 characters.
nestedFieldDescriptions.name: Web origin URL. Access to the devices applies to the entire web origin. Any path will be truncated. For detailed information on valid URL patterns, see https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/url-patterns. Note that using the "*" wildcard is not valid. The maximum size is 1000 characters.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: A list of USB devices allowed for this web origin. Each device has format 'vendor_id:product_id' where each of the IDs is a hexadecimal 4-char string. An example of a device ID: '1234:ab12'. The maximum size is 500000 characters (for all entries combined).
nestedFieldDescriptions.name: A list of USB devices allowed for this web origin. Each device has format 'vendor_id:product_id' where each of the IDs is a hexadecimal 4-char string. An example of a device ID: '1234:ab12'. The maximum size is 500000 characters (for all entries combined).
A list of web origins, each with its allowed USB devices.

fieldDescriptions.name: Allows automatically granting permissions to specific sites on the sign-in screen to connect to HID devices with the given vendor and product IDs.

fieldDescriptions.description: If this policy is disabled, this policy prevents enterprise admins from remote access to managed ChromeOS devices on the sign-in screen. This policy does not affect other remote access scenarios. This policy is not effective if enabled, left blank, not configured or RemoteAccessHostAllowEnterpriseRemoteSupportConnections is disabled.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Enable remote access connections from enterprise admins.
Prevent remote access connections from enterprise admins.

fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: If this policy is disabled, this policy prevents enterprise admins from remote access to managed ChromeOS devices on the sign-in screen. This policy does not affect other remote access scenarios. This policy is not effective if enabled, left blank, not configured or RemoteAccessHostAllowEnterpriseRemoteSupportConnections is disabled.

fieldDescriptions.description: Time until online login page refreshes. Enter a value between 5-10080 minutes. Leave empty to deactivate online login screen refresh.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Duration policy field accepts Long integer as input. Duration policy field value is in the range [5, 10080] (unit in minute).
fieldDescriptions.name: Time until online login page refreshes.
fieldDescriptions.fieldDescription: Enter a value between 5-10080 minutes. Leave empty to deactivate online login screen refresh.
